intro: Pouteria sessiliflora f. myrtifolia, commonly known as the myrtle-leaved pouteria, is a tropical plant belonging to the Sapotaceae family. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in small inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, fleshy drupe with a smooth, yellowish skin. This species is native to parts of South America and is often found in moist, shaded forest environments.
